00001 /*
00002 **  File Name:  cfe_psp.h
00003 **
00004 **      Copyright (c) 2004-2006, United States government as represented by the
00005 **      administrator of the National Aeronautics Space Administration.
00006 **      All rights reserved. This software(cFE) was created at NASA's Goddard
00007 **      Space Flight Center pursuant to government contracts.
00008 **
00009 **      This software may be used only pursuant to a United States government
00010 **      sponsored project and the United States government may not be charged
00011 **      for use thereof.
00012 **
00013 **  Author:  A. Cudmore
00014 **
00015 **  Purpose:  This file contains the cFE Platform Support Package(PSP) 
00016 **            prototypes.
00017 **            The PSP routines serve as the "glue" between the RTOS and
00018 **            the cFE Flight Software. The routines fill gaps that are not
00019 **            really considered part of the OS Abstraction, but are required
00020 **            for the cFE flight software implementation. It is possible that
00021 **            some of these routines could migrate into the OS AL.
00022 **
00023 **  $Log: cfe_psp.h  $
00024 **  Revision 1.3 2009/07/29 13:04:46EDT acudmore 
00025 **  Added Bank parameter to EEPROM Power up/down and EEPROM write enable/disable functions.
00026 **  Revision 1.2 2009/07/22 17:34:10EDT acudmore 
00027 **  Added new watchdog API
00028 **  Revision 1.1 2009/06/10 09:28:44EDT acudmore 
00029 **  Initial revision
00030 **  Member added to project c:/MKSDATA/MKS-REPOSITORY/CFE-PSP-REPOSITORY/fsw/inc/project.pj
00031 **
00032 */
00033

00130 /*
00131 ** PSP entry point and reset routines
00132 */
00133 extern void          CFE_PSP_Main(int ModeId, char *StartupFilePath);
00134 
00135 /*
00136 ** CFE_PSP_Main is the entry point that the real time OS calls to start our
00137 ** software. This routine will do any BSP/OS specific setup, then call the
00138 ** entrypoint of the flight software ( i.e. the cFE main entry point ).
00139 ** The flight software (i.e. cFE ) should not call this routine.
00140 */
00141 
00142 extern void         CFE_PSP_GetTime(OS_time_t *LocalTime);
00143 /* This call gets the local time from the hardware on the Vxworks system
00144  * on the mcp750s
00145  * on the other os/hardware setup, it will get the time the normal way */
00146 
00147 
00148 extern void          CFE_PSP_Restart(uint32 resetType);
00149 /*
00150 ** CFE_PSP_Restart is the entry point back to the BSP to restart the processor.
00151 ** The flight software calls this routine to restart the processor.
00152 */
00153 
00154 
00155 extern uint32        CFE_PSP_GetRestartType(uint32 *restartSubType );
00156 /*
00157 ** CFE_PSP_GetRestartType returns the last reset type and if a pointer to a valid
00158 ** memory space is passed in, it returns the reset sub-type in that memory.
00159 ** Right now the reset types are application specific. For the cFE they
00160 ** are defined in the cfe_es.h file.
00161 */
00162

00182 extern uint32 CFE_PSP_Get_Timer_Tick(void);
00183 /*
00184 ** CFE_PSP_Get_Timer_Tick returns the underlying OS timer tick value
00185 ** It is used for the performance monitoring software
00186 */
00187 
00188 extern uint32 CFE_PSP_GetTimerTicksPerSecond(void);
00189 /*
00190 ** CFE_PSP_GetTimerTicksPerSecond provides the resolution of the least significant
00191 ** 32 bits of the 64 bit time stamp returned by CFE_PSP_Get_Timebase in timer
00192 ** ticks per second.  The timer resolution for accuracy should not be any slower
00193 ** than 1000000 ticks per second or 1 us per tick
00194 */
00195 
00196 extern uint32 CFE_PSP_GetTimerLow32Rollover(void);
00197 /*
00198 ** CFE_PSP_GetTimerLow32Rollover provides the number that the least significant
00199 ** 32 bits of the 64 bit time stamp returned by CFE_PSP_Get_Timebase rolls over.
00200 ** If the lower 32 bits rolls at 1 second, then the CFE_PSP_TIMER_LOW32_ROLLOVER
00201 ** will be 1000000.  if the lower 32 bits rolls at its maximum value (2^32) then
00202 ** CFE_PSP_TIMER_LOW32_ROLLOVER will be 0.
00203 */
00204 
00205 extern void CFE_PSP_Get_Timebase(uint32 *Tbu, uint32 *Tbl);
00206 /*
00207 ** CFE_PSP_Get_Timebase
00208 */
00209 
00210 extern uint32 CFE_PSP_Get_Dec(void);
00211 /*
00212 ** CFE_PSP_Get_Dec
00213 */
00214 
00215 
00216 extern int32 CFE_PSP_InitProcessorReservedMemory(uint32 RestartType );
00217 /*
00218 ** CFE_PSP_InitProcessorReservedMemory initializes all of the memory in the
00219 ** BSP that is preserved on a processor reset. The memory includes the
00220 ** Critical Data Store, the ES Reset Area, the Volatile Disk Memory, and
00221 ** the User Reserved Memory. In general, the memory areas will be initialized
00222 ** ( cleared ) on a Power On reset, and preserved during a processor reset.
00223 */
00224 
00225 extern int32 CFE_PSP_GetCDSSize(uint32 *SizeOfCDS);
00226 /*
00227 ** CFE_PSP_GetCDSSize fetches the size of the OS Critical Data Store area.
00228 */
00229 
00230 extern int32 CFE_PSP_WriteToCDS(void *PtrToDataToWrite, uint32 CDSOffset, uint32 NumBytes);
00231 /*
00232 ** CFE_PSP_WriteToCDS writes to the CDS Block.
00233 */
00234 
00235 extern int32 CFE_PSP_ReadFromCDS(void *PtrToDataToRead, uint32 CDSOffset, uint32 NumBytes);
00236 /*
00237 ** CFE_PSP_ReadFromCDS reads from the CDS Block
00238 */
00239 
00240 extern int32 CFE_PSP_GetResetArea (void *PtrToResetArea, uint32 *SizeOfResetArea);
00241 /*
00242 ** CFE_PSP_GetResetArea returns the location and size of the ES Reset information area.
00243 ** This area is preserved during a processor reset and is used to store the
00244 ** ER Log, System Log and reset related variables
00245 */
00246 
00247 extern int32 CFE_PSP_GetUserReservedArea(void *PtrToUserArea, uint32 *SizeOfUserArea );
00248 /*
00249 ** CFE_PSP_GetUserReservedArea returns the location and size of the memory used for the cFE
00250 ** User reserved area.
00251 */
00252 
00253 extern int32 CFE_PSP_GetVolatileDiskMem(void *PtrToVolDisk, uint32 *SizeOfVolDisk );
00254 /*
00255 ** CFE_PSP_GetVolatileDiskMem returns the location and size of the memory used for the cFE
00256 ** volatile disk.
00257 */
00258

00289

00300 extern void CFE_PSP_Panic(int32 ErrorCode);
00301 /*
00302 ** CFE_PSP_Panic is called by the cFE Core startup code when it needs to abort the
00303 ** cFE startup. This should not be called by applications.
00304 */
00305 
00306 extern int32 CFE_PSP_InitSSR(uint32 bus, uint32 device, char *DeviceName );
00307 /*
00308 ** CFE_PSP_InitSSR will initialize the Solid state recorder memory for a particular platform
00309 */
00310 
00311 extern int32 CFE_PSP_Decompress( char * srcFileName, char * dstFileName );
00312 /*
00313 ** CFE_PSP_Decompress will uncompress the source file to the file specified in the
00314 ** destination file name. The Decompress uses the "gzip" algorithm. Files can
00315 ** be compressed using the "gzip" program available on almost all host platforms.
00316 */
00317 
00318 extern void  CFE_PSP_AttachExceptions(void);
00319 /*
00320 ** CFE_PSP_AttachExceptions will setup the exception environment for the chosen platform
00321 ** On a board, this can be configured to look at a debug flag or switch in order to
00322 ** keep the standard OS exeption handlers, rather than restarting the system
00323 */
00324 
00325 
00326 extern void CFE_PSP_SetDefaultExceptionEnvironment(void);
00327 /*
00328 **
00329 **   CFE_PSP_SetDefaultExceptionEnvironment defines the CPU and FPU exceptions that are enabled for each cFE Task/App
00330 **
00331 **   Notes: The exception environment is local to each task Therefore this must be
00332 **          called for each task that that wants to do floating point and catch exceptions
00333 */
00334
